clinical_study.brief_title: Esophageal Calibration During Laparoscopic Fundoplication Reduces Dysphagia
clinical_study.official_title: Esophageal Calibration With Soft Orogastric Tube During Laparoscopic Fundoplication Reduces Postoperative Transient Dysphagia

brief_summary.textblock: Gastro esophageal reflux is the most common benign disease of the esophagus and Laparoscopic Nissen fundoplication became the standard surgical treatment of this disease. Although being almost transient postoperative dysphagia is still a common complaint following this procedure. The aim of this study is to investigate the effect of inserting a soft structured and blunt mounted 39 F orogastric tube to postoperative dysphagia.

primary_outcome.description: This score system is used to assess the severity of dysphagia

arm_group.description: Esophageal calibration tube was applied to this group of patients during laparoscopic Nissen fundoplication operation
Standard Laparoscopic Nissen fundoplication without esophageal calibration

intervention.description: An orogastric calibration tube is inserted during laparoscopic Nissen fundoplication in order to secure a certain esophageal lumen for reducing postoperative dysphagia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Grade 3 or more esophagitis
- Hiatal hernia larger than 3 centimeters
- Acide suppression therapy history longer than 2 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Story of endoscopic mucosal resection for Barret's mucosa
